intro: Hedyotis wauensis, commonly known as the Wau rockstar, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of western Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in shaded forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine pubescence, while its flowers are white with prominent yellow stamens. Hedyotis wauensis is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and potential medicinal properties.
